title: The Case of the Bedroom Egg

pageData.text: The Case of the Bedroom Egg

A loud cracking noise woke me with a jolt.

Even though I was shivering, I threw off my blanket and hopped out of bed.

15

Being cold didn't matter, something was not right.

For a second the cracking stopped, all I could hear was the breeze in the window and my Mom making breakfast downstairs.

But then it started again.

The crack was not like glass or wood but with something more like a shell.

Mom was going to want me down for breakfast soon. Where was this noise coming from?

I knocked on the beach ball sized egg. It was so heavy it did not budge.

Whoever put this egg in my room must have been strong. It looks like I had a new case.

pageData.question: Who put this egg in my room?

pageData.text:
Suspect 1: Mom

I walked downstairs. As I suspected, my mother was making breakfast.

25

The kitchen was smoky, but this was usual. Mom always burnt the toast.

dee Mom, did you put a giant egg in my room?

mom We don't have time for this. Quick, eat your eggs Dee. You're going to be late to school.

dee Did you just say eggs? So you did hide the egg in my room!

mom I don't know what you are talking about. If you don't hurry, the bus will leave without you.

Usually it's Mom who is the culprit. A culprit is someone who did the crime.

Time was running out. I would have to ask the others at the breakfast table.

I turned to Dad. His eyes were closed and his head was nodded down.

35

He gave a loud yawn. He hadn't touched his eggs. He was also going to be late.

dee Dad, did you put the egg in my room?

dad ZZzzzzzzz.

dee Wake up Dad.

dad Zzzzzzz.

I took a glass of water and threw it at him. His eyes opened wide. I tried again.

357

dee Dad, did you put the egg in my room?

dadSorry Dee, I was up late last night, bowling with your Uncle TBone.deeBut what about the egg?

dadThe only eggs I know about are the ones I'm eating in front of me.

Suspect 3: Uncle TBone

Mom was in a hurry, Dad was tired, the only other suspect at the table was Uncle TBone.

46

Now I didn't know Uncle TBone very well. And Mom said I should be polite.

But the case was running cold.

Running cold means that I was running out of clues and might not solve the crime.

deeUncle TBone, did you put an egg in my room?

tbone..................

Uncle TBone just stared at me blankly.

I was running out of time. I would have to ask again.

deeUncle TBone, did you put an egg in my room?

tbone ROOOoooooar!!!

It sounded like something was in Uncle TBone's throat.

I was expecting Uncle TBone to tell me to mind my own business.

But instead, he lifted his legs on the table and started putting claw marks all over the wood.

Take note: I hope Mom won't blame me for those scratches.

While clawing the table, Uncle TBone opened his mouth wide. He had a bunch of sharp teeth.

457

And I also noticed his skin seemed rather green and scaly.

tboneROOOAR!!!!!

deeSo I take it you don't want to talk about the egg?

I put my clues together:

1. Uncle TBone roared like a wild animal.

2. He also smelled like a wild animal. But I didn't want to write that down.

3. Uncle TBone had claws and skin like a reptile.

Putting the clues together, I decided Uncle TBone was a real dinosaur.

From school, I had also learned that dinosaurs lay eggs!

pageData.question: Click on who would put an egg in my room.

pageData.text:
I pointed my finger at TBone, the way detectives do.

deeIt was you who put the egg in my room!

425

tbone??????

tboneROOOAR!!!!!

I think dinosaurs scare easily because Uncle TBone jumped out of his seat and straight through the window.

55

Glass crashed everywhere I hope Mom doesn't think that was my fault.
Chasing Dinosaurs

pageData.question: Choose how you want to find Uncle TBone.
answers: Ask your dog Toby for help.

pageData.text:
Mom didn't really notice the window crash, she was too focused on the burning bacon.

deeMom do you know where Uncle TBone went?momOh no. He left without finishing his eggs!

deeFocus Mom, you don't want me to miss school.

momHe must have gone back to the toolshed. He's been spending a lot of time back there.

It looks like I was going to need to call in help from my dog Toby.

I whistled, and Toby came running downstairs, nearly knocking me over.

I petted Toby and showed him the torn clothes TBone left all over the table.

Toby smelled the shirt and looked disgusted. I don't blame him, it did smell bad. I wouldn't want to smell it either.

After a few seconds, Toby jumped up from the table and ran out the window. As I walked around, I saw Toby energetically smelling the toolshed.

Now I'm not very tall and that glass looks really dangerous.

Are you sure you want me to jump through that window with broken glass?
<align=center>Are you really sure?

Summoning up all my bravery I took a step back. Jumped on the table. And started running as fast as I could.

Around the uneaten eggs.

Around sleeping Dad.

And then I jumped.

I made it through to the other side, without a scratch.

Jumping through the window saved me just enough time to see something that looked like a dinosaur tail run into the woods.

It was raining pretty hard outside and my clothes started to get cold. As I walked toward the tool shed I held my breath.

I couldn't hear anything but the dripping of the rain.

I cracked the rotting door open.

Nothing was inside. Uncle TBone must have escaped! I looked around the tool shed.

Lucky for me, the rain made mud and there were footprints leading off in different directions.

Here is a picture of the three different footprints I saw.

610

I pulled out my smart phone and went to the University of Colorado's webpage: Dinosaurs have four toes. Three in the front and one in the back.

When they step, they step on their toes, which makes them look taller.

Because they step on their front toes, they do not leave a foot print in the back.

If you look at a Dinosaur footprint you would only see three web like toes in the front.

I headed to the library. I hoped the readers were all right.

I jogged for 10 minutes, following the path towards my library.

But the muddy foot prints didn't go into the building.

Instead, the tracks headed around the side of the library to Long Neck Lake.

He must have jumped in.

I lost him. The case was turning cold again.

As I turned around, I saw a note pinned high in a tree. I jumped to take it off, but slipped in the mud and tore the note in half.

78

Case Closed.

Today I learned who put the egg in my bedroom. It was Uncle TBone, who is actually a dinosaur.

He put the egg in my room because he is in danger and needs to hide.

I wonder what he is hiding from.

And why does this egg keep making cracking sounds?

96
